title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 14): Building Homes Together - Tiny House Villages and Ecovillages as Power With Solutions
summary: Start tiny house villages and ecovillages as alternatives to the housing crisis. Build cooperative living based on care, autonomy, and interdependence rather than profit and control.

Community.summary: Create cooperative living arrangements that embody shared responsibility and mutual care.

level0: Gather people concerned about housing - especially those with housing insecurity
Choose structure together - tiny homes, ecovillage, or renovated units
level1: Secure land or space through collective action
Co-design homes and common spaces as a group
level2: Create governance system based on consent and care
Connect with local mutual aid networks
level3: Support others in starting similar projects

Knowledge.summary: Learn sustainable building and cooperative living skills through shared practice.

level0: Research zoning laws and legal pathways for alternative housing
Learn about sustainable building techniques and materials
level1: Practice shared decision-making and conflict resolution
Develop skills in construction, renewable energy, and food growing
level2: Include everyone in design, construction, and governance decisions
Teach others about cooperative living and community building
level3: Become resource for alternative housing development
Create educational materials about Power With living

Narrative.summary: Model alternatives to individualized housing that demonstrate cooperative possibilities.

level0: Practice seeing housing as relationship rather than commodity
Challenge narratives about individual home ownership
level1: Share stories about cooperative living and mutual aid
Model interdependence as strength rather than weakness
level2: Help others envision alternatives to nuclear family housing
level3: Transform community understanding of home and belonging
Build culture where cooperative living is normalized and celebrated
